H0.text: At the 1976 Olympics, which Cuban athlete became the first person to win both the 400m and the 800m. Alberto Juantorena's teammate, Alejandro Casa√±as

H1.text: At the 1976 Olympics, which Cuban athlete became the first person to win both the 400m and the 800m. Cuban sprinter, Silvio Leonard

H2.text: At the 1976 Olympics, which Cuban athlete became the first person to win both the 400m and the 800m. Middle-distance runner, Mike Boit

H3.text: At the 1976 Olympics, which Cuban athlete became the first person to win both the 400m and the 800m. Juantorena

A4.text: Alberto Juantorena is the only athlete to win both the 400 and 800 m Olympic titles, which he achieved in 1976.

A5.text: By winning the 400 meters, he became the first athlete since Paul Pilgrim at the 1906 Intercalated Games to do such a double at an Olympic sports event, and was the only man to do so at an officially recognized Olympics.
